snippet: A temporary truce in Syria offers little relief to its civilians from the appalling damage of the civil war.
abstract: Editorial expresses concern that evacuation amidst marred ceasefire in Syrian city of Homs is likely to save only a fraction of the civilians in danger; calls on United Nations Security Council to extend ceasefire and pressure government and rebels to allow organizations delivering humanitarian aid across Syria to operate freely; offers recommendations for easing roadblocks to political solution for country's civil war.
lead_paragraph: A temporary truce in Syria offers little relief to its civilians from the appalling damage of the civil war.

keywords.value: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies
